page.title: 19A boat trip
page.content: {Southend pier to Bell Wharf} If you are going along the ray on a boat towards Leigh Creek, you will pass Southend, Westcliff, Chalkwell and Old Leigh. The ray is a deep channel of water about a mile from Southend fore-shore. It is used by the fishing industry or any large boats making for Leigh. The baginning of the ray is marked by the Leigh buoy. At high tide the water is 12 feet and when you get to the ray it drops to 60 feet. It is one of the best defined water channels in Britain. It used to be owned by the Salvation Army but they sold it to Southend Council. From the boat you can see the Royal Hotel, the Cliffs Pavilion, the Alexandra Yacht Club, the Cliff Gardens, beach huts, kiosks, Chalkwell station & St Clements church. Written by Lydia Lempriere (11yrs)
